topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538911016368726d97ab0300#post_538911016368726d97ab0300
The problem is, people just can't seem to relate to the cold bland exterior of Modern Architecture. Architecture is a form of art, like a language of some sort. At the same time, functional. And this is the case for thousands of years of civilization. There is a reason people cycled to certain classical styles for a long time since antiquity. It's sort of like a "Feng shui":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feng_shui type of thing. A harmony between humans, buildings, and nature.

topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538914ef6368726e2c170500#post_538914ef6368726e2c170500
No type of architecture can solve homelessness at this rate. As long as people feel the constant need to reproduce. Same goes for hunger.
Trying to solve these two problems in the world is nothing more than a pipe dream.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5389161a6368726b7f830500#post_5389161a6368726b7f830500
They say the world only has enough space and resources for 2 billion people, we have about 7 billion right now. What's more is the more people we have the more pollution we make which makes crops even harder to grow as if there wasn't a shortage already. Also the more people we have means more land is need which means less land for farms.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5389182163687224790e0000#post_5389182163687224790e0000
I don't think so. America may have a lot of food but our surplus is not enough to feed all the people starving out there. There may be enough food if we could grow it in what is now arid land. Most other countries may have a little excess but even all the combined excess of those countries, even if you include American "food", would not be able to properly feed over a billion people.
